comment._content: My guess is somewhere off the coast of Normandy in France, just after June 6th, 1944.

comment._content: Is in Normandy i bin there the las week amazing!!!!!!!

comment.author: 49171298@N05
comment._content: It's the landing group in the Philippine Sea. Task Force 58.

comment.author: 76863906@N02
comment._content: It's Ulithi anchorage in the South Pacific.  There were no large numbers of CVL/CVE (light carriers) at Normandy, and I see several here in the distance.

comment.author: 17982267@N08
comment._content: This is Seeadler Harbor in the Admiralties on 6 October 1945. The invasion fleet for Leyte in the Philippines. See same photo after page 134 in Admiral Samuel Eliot Morison's History of Naval Operations in WWII, Vol 12 "Leyte"
